We carefully tailor individual compensation packages, including base pay, taking into consideration employees' job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and other relevant business factors.

Beyond base pay, we offer a Total Rewards package that may include participation in our annual bonus program, equity, and other forms of compensation, in addition to a full range of medical, retirement, and lifestyle benefits. More details can be found here.

We're committed to fair and equitable pay practices, as well as pay transparency. We regularly review our programs to ensure they remain competitive and aligned with our values.

*We wholeheartedly embrace and actively seek applications from all individuals, no matter how they identify. We are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe our work is enriched when we incorporate a multitude of perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences. We want everyone who works here to thrive and contribute to not only our mission of keeping every home secure, but also to making our workplace safe and supportive for others. If a reasonable accommodation may be needed to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of a position, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact* *careers@simplisafe.com**.*

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**Ready to lead with vision and drive real results?**  
We’re looking for a dynamic sales leader who thrives on building high-performing teams, accelerating growth, and shaping the future of our business. If you’re energized by strategy, execution, and inspiring others to succeed, this is your opportunity to make a lasting impact.

At **Didion**, we’re more than a producer of food-grade grain and soy products—we’re fueling innovation, sustainability, and excellence across the industry. As our **Vice President of Sales**, you’ll lead domestic mill, government, and small packaging sales operations, setting the course for growth while empowering a passionate team to deliver exceptional results.

What You’ll Do:

* **Lead with Vision:** Develop and execute bold sales strategies that align with our business goals and market opportunities.
* **Build a Rockstar Team:** Mentor and grow a high-performing sales force that thrives on collaboration, accountability, and results.
* **Drive Customer Success:** Cultivate strong relationships with key accounts and ensure a consistent, value-driven customer experience.
* **Champion Innovation:** Stay ahead of market trends, identify new opportunities, and support product development initiatives.
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** Work closely with marketing, operations, and finance to align efforts and maximize impact.
* **Make Data Your Superpower:** Use insights and analytics to guide decisions, forecast performance, and optimize sales operations.

What You Bring:

* A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA = bonus points!)
* 8+ years of progressive sales leadership experience——**ideally in the food manufacturing or ingredient industry**
* Proven success managing multi-channel sales teams and exceeding revenue targets
* Experience representing your company in industry groups or associations
* A passion for coaching, developing talent, and building lasting customer relationships
* Willingness to travel and maintain a strong presence at our Cambria facility
* Why You’ll Love It Here:
* A chance to lead with purpose and shape the future of a growing, mission-driven company
* A collaborative culture that values curiosity, continuous learning, and innovation
* Opportunities to make a real impact—on your team, your customers, and the industry
* Competitive compensation and benefits, plus the satisfaction of doing meaningful work

Ready to lead with impact?

  

**Apply now** and help us take Didion’s sales strategy—and our customer relationships—to the next level.

*Didion Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We urge all qualified applicants to apply for this position. Selection will be based on qualifications as they relate to position requirements without regard to race, color, national origin, religion sex, age, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, genetic information, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected class.*

*Didion uses the eVerify system to confirm eligibility to work in the United States.*

title: Chief Commercial Officer
description:
**About Neuramod**

Neuramod is an early-stage health technology company building the next generation of **AI-driven longevity, performance, and preventative health systems**.

We operate at the intersection of:

* AI health technology
* Longevity science
* B2B health infrastructure (gyms, clinics, employers)
* Scalable consumer health services

Our platform integrates **software, coaching/telehealth access, and applied health systems** to modernize how health is delivered, monetized, and sustained. We are currently in the **pre-seed / seed preparation phase**, with active traction and revenue pathways, and are seeking funding to accelerate product development, partnerships, and distribution.

This role is foundational to that growth.

**Role Overview**

Neuramod is seeking a **Chief Commercial Officer (CCO)** to assume executive ownership of **revenue execution, partnerships, and go-to-market commercialization** across our B2B and B2C offerings.

This is a **foundational executive role**, not a late-stage replacement position. The CCO will work in **direct collaboration with the CEO/founder**, taking over existing commercial operations and scaling them into repeatable, fundable revenue systems.

The role is structured to **transition into a fully salaried C-suite position following the completion of our seed funding round**, while offering meaningful upside through equity and commission during the pre-funding phase.

**What You Will Own**

* Lead revenue generation across:
* Gym and clinic integrations
* Employer longevity packages
* AI health app access
* Coaching access and services
* Execute and refine sales scripts, pricing logic, and conversion systems in collaboration with the CEO
* Own both **B2B partnership sales** and **select B2C monetization**, adapting approach based on product type
* Convert early traction into fundable revenue narratives and predictable growth

**Partnerships & Distribution**

* Establish and manage strategic partnerships with:
* Gyms and fitness facilities
* Clinics and health practices
* Employers and organizations seeking preventative health solutions
* Represent Neuramod in high-level commercial discussions and negotiations
* Help structure long-term distribution relationships that scale beyond founder-led sales

**Go-to-Market Leadership**

* Assume operational ownership of commercial systems already in place
* Collaborate closely with product, engineering, and marketing to align offerings with market demand
* Build toward scalable sales infrastructure as revenue milestones are achieved
* Participate directly in investor-facing discussions related to revenue, growth, and commercialization strategy

**Future Leadership & Scale**

* Upon reaching defined revenue milestones, lead the build-out and management of a commercial team
* Evolve the role into a full C-suite growth and revenue leadership position post-funding
* Help guide expansion into future offerings including supplementation, diagnostics, meals, and advanced longevity services

**Who This Role Is For**

This role is ideal for someone who:

* Has **strong B2B sales and partnership experience**, ideally within health, wellness, or enterprise services
* Is deeply interested in **longevity, preventative health, and human performance**
* Is comfortable operating in an **early-stage environment** where upside replaces short-term certainty
* Has experience with:
* Cold outreach and relationship-driven sales
* High-performance selling
* Complex offerings that blend product + service
* Wants a **true executive trajectory**, not a capped sales role

**Qualifications**

* **10+ years of commercial experience**, with **5+ years in senior or executive leadership** (Director, VP, GM, C-level).
* **Direct experience in the longevity, health, digital health, or preventative care space is required.**
* Proven record of **driving B2B revenue and strategic partnerships**, ideally across clinics, gyms, employers, or health systems.
* Demonstrated success selling **complex, high-value offerings** that blend technology, services, and long-term outcomes.
* Strong command of **enterprise sales, cold outreach, relationship-driven growth, and long sales cycles**.
* Experience translating early traction into **repeatable, fundable revenue systems**.
* Comfortable operating in **early-stage, high-ambiguity environments** without heavy infrastructure.
* Ability to collaborate closely with founders while **owning execution and accountability**.
* Executive-level communication skills with credibility in **investor, partner, and enterprise buyer conversations**.
* Deep personal alignment with **longevity, preventative health, and human performance**.

**Role Structure & Employment Transition**

This role will **initially be engaged on a contract basis** during Neuramod’s pre-seed and seed fundraising phase.

During this period, the Chief Commercial Officer will operate as a **contract executive**, compensated through a combination of **commission-based earnings and equity**, while playing a core leadership role in driving commercial traction and supporting funding objectives.

Upon the successful completion of our seed funding round and the transition into our next stage of growth, this role is designed to **convert into a full-time, salaried executive position (W-2 / FTE)**, with a market-competitive base salary, continued incentive compensation, and ongoing equity vesting.

**Compensation & Equity Structure - Pre-Funding (Current Phase)**

* **Commission-based compensation** on revenue generated
* Tiered commission structure that rewards early traction
* **Equity grant (2–4%) in a sales-focused subsidiary**, subject to vesting and performance milestones

**Post-Seed Funding**

* Transition to a **market-competitive executive salary at posted salary range**
* Ongoing commission or profit-share on direct commercial activities
* Continued equity vesting aligned with long-term growth

**Equity Terms**

* 4-year vesting with performance-based acceleration tied to revenue and funding outcomes
* Unvested equity forfeited upon departure
* Buyback provisions apply per standard early-stage executive agreements

**Important Context**

This role is **not** designed for someone seeking immediate salary security.

It **is** designed for a commercial leader who wants:

* Meaningful ownership
* A direct line to C-suite authority
* A defining role in shaping how health and longevity are commercialized at scale

**How to Apply**

To apply, please submit:

* A brief overview of your commercial or sales leadership experience
* Why longevity and preventative health matter to you
* Your interest in building alongside an early-stage founder and executive team

Pay: $150,000.00 - $190,000.00 per year

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Experience:

* senior or executive-level role: 5 years (Required)
* sales, partnerships, or commercial leadership: 10 years (Required)
* longevity, health, wellness, biotech, or digital health: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) – 503B Outsourcing Facility
description:
**Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) – 503B Outsourcing Facility**

**Location:** On-site (GlobalRx Sterile Manufacturing Division)  
**Reports to:** COO  
**Compensation:** $220,000–$260,000 + performance incentives

**About GlobalRx**

GlobalRx is a fast-growing specialty pharmaceutical distributor serving health systems, hospitals, clinics, wellness networks, and international partners across more than 50 countries. Following the acquisition and integration of Legere Pharmaceuticals, GlobalRx is now expanding into sterile manufacturing through the launch of a **state-of-the-art 503B FDA-registered outsourcing facility**.

Our goal is to build an industry-leading operation comparable to top 503B players such as **Nephron Pharmaceuticals, SCA Pharma, Athenex, Empower Pharmacy, and Olympia Pharmaceuticals**—delivering high-quality, cGMP-compliant sterile products backed by innovation, safety, and operational excellence.

We are now seeking a **Chief Commercial Officer (CCO)** who will architect the commercial strategy, build a top-tier sales organization, oversee the product portfolio, and drive revenue growth for our new sterile manufacturing division.

**Position Summary**

The **Chief Commercial Officer (CCO)** will be the senior executive responsible for defining and executing the entire commercial strategy for GlobalRx’s 503B Outsourcing Facility.

This leader will:

· Build a **competitive sterile product pipeline** (injectables, IVs, office-use medications).

· Lead **pricing strategy**, margin optimization, and customer segmentation.

· Develop and scale a **high-performing national sales team**.

· Establish strategic partnerships with hospitals, GPOs, wholesalers, and provider networks.

· Drive commercial planning, forecasting, and long-term revenue strategy.

· Translate market needs into product development opportunities.

The CCO will be a **foundational operator** who understands how to win in the 503B market and has proven success leading commercial teams in sterile manufacturing.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Commercial Strategy & Revenue Leadership**

· Build and execute a **comprehensive commercial roadmap** for the 503B division.

· Identify product opportunities that match market demand (shortages, injectables, IV therapies, anesthesia, ophthalmics, etc.).

· Lead the development of GlobalRx’s **503B sterile product portfolio** from concept to commercialization.

· Develop multi-year commercial forecasts, revenue targets, and strategic growth plans.

· Own P&L responsibility for the commercial organization.

**Pipeline Development & Product Strategy**

· Assess market trends, shortage data, and competitive intelligence to define product priorities.

· Collaborate with Quality, R&D, Operations, and Regulatory to bring products to market efficiently.

· Design launch plans, positioning, and go-to-market strategies for all 503B products.

· Evaluate costs, pricing, reimbursement considerations, and customer demand to maximize margin.

**Sales Leadership & Team Building**

· Build and lead a **national sales organization**, including field reps, account managers, and inside sales.

· Establish performance metrics, training, quotas, and incentives.

· Create a high-accountability culture that delivers consistent volume growth.

· Implement CRM systems, pipeline management frameworks, and customer segmentation strategies.

**Customer, Market & Partnership Development**

· Drive hospital and health-system adoption through strong clinical, operational, and pricing value propositions.

· Build partnerships with:

o GPOs

o IDNs

o Wholesalers

o Surgery centers

o Large multi-state clinics

o Physician group networks

· Expand GlobalRx’s reach into federal, state, and international markets.

**Pricing, Margin & Contracting Strategy**

· Establish competitive pricing models for 503B sterile medications.

· Balance cost-of-goods, market pricing ranges, margin goals, and customer loyalty programs.

· Develop contract structures for:

o Volume discounts

o GPO agreements

o Long-term supply partnerships

o Office-use standing orders

· Ensure full alignment with FDA 503B guidance and legal contract requirements.

**Cross-Functional Leadership**

· Work closely with Operations, Quality, and Regulatory to ensure:

o Product availability

o Compliance with USP and FDA requirements

o Efficient product launches

o Timely resolution of supply issues

· Serve as the “voice of the customer” in internal decision-making.

**Qualifications**

**Required**

· **8+ years of commercial leadership experience** in a **503B FDA Outsourcing Facility** or sterile injectable pharmaceutical environment.

· Proven success in:

o Building a product pipeline

o Launching new sterile products

o Pricing strategy and margin optimization

o Leading sales organizations to significant growth

· Deep understanding of cGMP manufacturing, USP requirements, and FDA 503B regulatory frameworks.

· Strong experience selling into hospitals, GPOs, IDNs, clinics, national networks, and physician groups.

· Demonstrated ability to scale commercial operations and drive multi-million-dollar revenue expansion.

· Strong communication, negotiation, and executive leadership presence.

**Preferred**

· Experience working at top 503B facilities (Nephron, SCA, Athenex, Empower, Olympia, Leiters).

· MBA, MS, PharmD, or other relevant advanced degree.

· Experience building a 503B commercial division from the ground up.

· Established network of hospital, GPO, and distributor relationships.

**Ideal Candidate Profile**

The ideal CCO will be:

· A commercial builder who has led successful growth in a 503B environment.

· A strategic thinker who understands sterile product economics, shortages, and competitive dynamics.

· A relationship-driven executive with strong ties to GPOs, hospitals, wholesalers, and large clinical networks.

· Obsessive about product quality, compliance, and service—aligned with the expectations of a cGMP/FDA-regulated sterile manufacturer.

· Capable of launching GlobalRx into the 503B market with speed, discipline, and commercial excellence.

**What This Role Delivers**

The Chief Commercial Officer will be responsible for turning GlobalRx’s new 503B facility into a top-tier sterile outsourcing supplier by:

· Building a competitive product portfolio

· Creating strong market differentiation

· Scaling profitable revenue

· Establishing national commercial reach

· Delivering durable customer relationships

· Positioning GlobalRx among the industry's most respected 503B providers

This is a **mission-critical executive role** for GlobalRx’s next phase of growth.

**We Offer**

* Competitive base salary plus performance-based bonuses
* Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, vision, PTO, etc.)
* Opportunities for professional development and leadership growth
* A compliant, innovation-driven culture that fosters excellence

Take the next step in your career with GLOBALRx. Apply now and join us in shaping the future of pharmaceutical distribution!

Pay: $220,000.00 - $260,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Chief Revenue Officer
description:
**Chief Revenue Officer**
-------------------------

**Location:** Maui, Hawaiʻi (with statewide travel)  
**Reports to:** President  
**Employment Type:** Full-Time, Exempt  
**Department:** Executive  
**Compensation:** $275,000 - $350,000 annual base salary, plus bonus eligibility and executive benefits

  

**The Opportunity**

Alpha Inc. is calling in a **Chief Revenue Officer with grit, clarity, and a fearless growth mindset**.  
Not someone who sits back and analyzes from afar—but someone who jumps in, builds the engine while it's running, and isn't afraid to make bold, informed bets.

  

This role owns the **entire revenue lifecycle**: lead generation, sales strategy, estimating alignment, marketing direction, client experience, and long-term revenue performance. You'll turn insights into action, strategy into systems, and relationships into long-term value.

  

If you thrive in fast-moving environments, have the courage to pursue ambitious goals, and know how to turn opportunity into measurable results—you'll feel at home here.

  

**About Alpha Inc.**

Alpha Inc. is a Hawaiʻi-built, Hawaiʻi-proud company leading in heavy civil construction, water well drilling, renewable energy, and concrete services. The projects we build today shape the future of island communities for generations—and we don't take that lightly.

We live and lead through three core values:

* **Lead with Heart** – Empathy, humility, and genuine care for people and community.
* **Strength in Unity** – We win together. No silos. No ego. Just one Alpha.
* **Alpha Mentality** – Grit, accountability, and the relentless pursuit of excellence in everything we do.

As CRO, you aren't just generating revenue—you're advancing our mission and amplifying these values across the entire revenue engine.

**What You Will Do**

  

**Revenue Strategy & Enterprise Leadership**

* Architect and oversee Alpha's end-to-end revenue strategy across construction, concrete, and energy business lines.
* Align sales, estimating, marketing, and operations into a unified, data-driven growth system.
* Convert market insights and client needs into actionable go-to-market execution plans.
* Set ambitious revenue and margin targets—and hit them.

**Sales & Marketing Operations**

* Design scalable sales processes and build a high-performance, metrics-driven sales organization.
* Own funnel optimization: lead gen qualification bid close account expansion.
* Partner with Estimating and Operations to ensure accurate proposals and seamless project delivery.
* Shape marketing priorities that enhance brand authority, strengthen demand, and grow client loyalty.

**Client Success & Profitability**

* Drive client satisfaction, retention, and long-term growth through value creation.
* Lead contract strategy and negotiations—balancing opportunity, margin, and risk.
* Monitor gross margin and pricing performance, and identify levers to improve profitability.

**Team Leadership & Culture**

* Build and motivate cross-functional teams that operate with urgency, clarity, and unity.
* Establish KPIs, rhythms, and performance systems across all revenue functions.
* Champion a culture of accountability and continuous improvement—celebrating wins and learning fast.

  

**What You Bring**

  

**Experience**

* 10+ years in progressive revenue leadership roles, including **5+ years in senior executive capacity**.
* Proven success in B2B revenue strategy, sales operations, and client lifecycle management.
* Industry experience in construction, infrastructure, energy, or service-based environments preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to unify sales, marketing, estimating, and operations around shared growth goals.
* Track record of hitting aggressive revenue targets in dynamic, complex environments.

**Skills & Leadership Qualities**

* Masterful communicator and cross-functional influencer.
* Expert in pricing strategy, contract negotiation, and margin protection.
* Analytical, tech-forward, and obsessed with outcomes.
* A growth architect who thrives in ambiguity and acts decisively.
* A leader who embodies **Lead with Heart, Strength in Unity, and Alpha Mentality**.

  

**Why Alpha?**

Because this isn't a maintenance job—it's a *legacy-building* role.

  

You'll help shape how Alpha grows, how we serve our clients, and how we deliver excellence as we scale across Hawaiʻi. You'll work closely with the CEO and executive team to steer the company into its next era—grounded in courage, community, and clarity of purpose.

  

If you want to lead a revenue engine that is bold, values-driven, and poised for major growth—this is your moment.

  

**Requirements (Conditions of Employment)**

Employment at Alpha Inc. is contingent upon:

* Completion of standard pre-employment screening.
* Successful completion of a background check conducted after a conditional offer; any prior issues will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis consistent with Hawaiʻi and federal law.
* Passing a drug test (for both full-time and part-time hires) conducted in line with Hawaiʻi statutory requirements.

  

Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States; we are unable to sponsor employment visas. Employment eligibility will be verified upon hire.

  

If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or hiring process, please contact us at careers@alphahawaii.com.

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Alpha Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on any protected status under federal or Hawaiʻi law, and we provide equal opportunity in all employment practices, including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, and training.

  

If you're ready to **drive bold growth, elevate client partnerships, and lead with heart and intensity**, Alpha Inc. wants to meet you.  
  
#LI-ALPHAEB

title: Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)
description:
**About Plutus Health Inc.:**  
Plutus Health Inc. is a leading provider of Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) services with SOC2 Certification. We are dedicated to helping healthcare providers improve their financial performance. Our expertise spans across various specialties. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients. As a result, **Plutus Health Inc. has been recognized on the 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America and ranked 100 in the Dallas area. Additionally, the company has been a 2024 finalist in the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year.**

Position Overview:
  
The Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) will be responsible for overseeing all revenue-generating activities within Plutus Health Inc. This C-suite executive will develop and implement strategies to increase sales, expand market presence, and maximize revenue opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in driving revenue growth within the healthcare or RCM industry.  
  
Key Responsibilities:  
  
1. Revenue Growth Strategy:  

* Develop and execute comprehensive revenue generation strategies that align with the company’s overall goals.
* Identify new market opportunities and lead initiatives to capture additional market share.
* Drive sales growth through effective sales strategies, partnerships, and business development activities.

  
2. Sales Leadership:  

* Lead, mentor, and develop the sales team to achieve and exceed revenue targets.
* Establish and monitor sales performance metrics, ensuring accountability and continuous improvement.
* Foster a high-performance sales culture focused on customer satisfaction and revenue growth.

  
3. Market Expansion:  

* Identify and evaluate new market segments and customer needs.
* Develop and implement strategies to enter new markets and expand the company’s footprint.
* Collaborate with marketing to create targeted campaigns that drive demand and brand awareness.

  
4. Client Relationship Management:  

* Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients and partners.
* Ensure high levels of client satisfaction and retention.
* Develop strategies to upsell and cross-sell services to existing clients.

  
5. Revenue Operations:  

* Oversee the development and implementation of pricing strategies.
* Collaborate with finance to forecast revenue, set targets, and monitor performance against goals.
* Ensure the alignment of sales, marketing, and operations to drive revenue growth.

  
6. Data-Driven Decision Making:  

* Utilize data analytics to inform strategic decisions and optimize revenue-generating activities.
* Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to stay ahead of the curve.
* Provide regular reports and updates to the executive team on revenue performance and opportunities.

  
Qualifications:  
  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in revenue generation roles, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership position.
* Proven track record of driving revenue growth in the healthcare or RCM industry.
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire high-performing sales teams.
* Proficiency in CRM software and data analytics tools.

  
Why Plutus Health Inc.:  
  

* Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team.
* Play a key role in shaping the revenue strategy of a growing company.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.

title: Chief Revenue Officer
description:
MetroTech Automotive is looking for a **Chief Revenue Officer** to drive revenue growth and oversee all revenue-generating departments of the corporation. MetroTech Automotive is a firmly established company of 38 years based in Charlotte, NC. We are a manufacturer of car care products and a well-renowned automotive partner of car dealerships nationwide.

**Responsibilities & Duties (included but not limited to):**

* Develop sales and marketing growth strategies with the President and CFO
* Build upon the legacy of a privately-owned, 38-year automotive organization with an excellent reputation in the automotive industry
* Manage the company's sales structure and direction
* Optimize and manage the overall revenue cycle from lead generation to customer retention
* Build and lead high-performance sales, marketing, and customer support teams
* Collaborate with product development teams to ensure product offerings are meeting and exceeding the market demands
* Optimize pricing models to maximize profitability while maintaining customer value
* Oversee and manage the overall marketing strategy of the organization
* Drive new business through ownership of all external and new customer go-to-market efforts
* Maintain communication and relationships across organizational functions to work with different departments and manage the revenue of those departments
* Identify and create micro-markets with specific products and services for those markets
* Manage all revenue channel development and introduce new sales channels and partners

**Requirements & Qualifications:**

* Automotive experience, preferably on the vendor side
* Willing to relocate to Charlotte, NC
* 15+ years of relevant experience
* Strong team player, results orientated, and sense of urgency to achieve business objectives
* Data-driven decision-making approach with proficiency in analytics tools
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Organizational and time management skills
* Ability to build relationships
* Compensation DOE

**Benefits:**

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* 401(k)
* Profit Sharing
* Monthly Commissions
* Bonus Program
* Vacation Pay
* Holiday Pay

**Please submit your resume to: careers@metrotechauto.com.**

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, disability, or any other federal, state, or local protected class.*

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

title: Variety: Group SVP, Consumer Sales
description:
Variety: Group SVP, Consumer Sales

Variety, the iconic entertainment media brand is seeking a dynamic and experienced head of consumer ad sales to scale the non-endemic sales team in driving revenue growth and cultivating strategic partnerships. The Group SVP Consumer Sales will be responsible for the direction and achievement of ad revenue targets, formulate the ad strategies, including product development and territory management. The ideal candidate will have over 15 -20 years of proven success in media ad sales with a robust network of industry clients and prospects, and a strong track record of leadership and innovation. As PMC values in-person collaboration and team cohesion, employees work onsite 4 days a week and 1 day remotely with a focus on maintaining a vibrant and inclusive culture.

**RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:**

* Lead and oversee all aspects of the ad sales function, including strategy development, revenue forecasting, and client relationship management.
* Develop and execute comprehensive sales plans to achieve revenue targets and maximize profitability across multiple platforms and channels.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with advertising agencies, brands, and key stakeholders, serving as the primary point of contact for all ad sales initiatives.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including brand solutions, marketing, content development and finance to align ad sales strategies with overall business objectives and priorities.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscape to identify new opportunities and drive innovation in ad sales tactics and solutions.
* Develop and implement performance metrics and KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of ad sales efforts and optimize resource allocation accordingly.
* Manage a sales team of 7 executives accountable for achieving significant sales goals across regions.
* Provide leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the ad sales team, fostering a culture of excellence, accountability, and continuous learning.
* Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and client meetings, demonstrating thought leadership and promoting our brands and offerings.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* 15 – 20 years of experience in advertising sales; ideally minimum 5 years running a national team. Must have a proven track record of selling branded content, events, video across digital, social, non-traditional media as well as print. Ideally the perfect candidate will have significant experience working with talent, creators and influencers in branded campaigns.
* Bachelor's degree in related field or an equivalent combination of skills, training and hands-on experience.
* Proven track record of exceeding revenue targets and driving sales growth in a competitive market environment.
* Must understand the entertainment industry and competitive environment including knowledge of competitive product offerings.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence key stakeholders at all levels.
* Strategic thinker with a creative mindset and a passion for innovation and problem-solving.
* Strong leader in setting directions for the team and achieving large sales goals; ability to inspire and motivate team members to achieve their full potential.
* Proficiency in CRM systems, sales analytics tools, and Microsoft Office Suite.

Typical wage range: $245k - $275k + bonus. Factors that could be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, years of experience and comparison to current employees already in this role. If you have more or less experience than specified on this job posting, please apply and list your salary expectations.

If hired, employee will be in an "at-will position" and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors).

**It's all About You…**

PMC's comprehensive benefits package is thoughtfully designed to support every aspect of your life, empowering you to thrive both personally and professionally. *We offer PMC-Paid Healthcare with no employee paycheck contributions on medical, dental, and vision for you and your family.* PMC also offers Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care & Commuter), an Employee Assistance Program, Life Insurance, Short- & Long-Term Disability, Paid Parental Leave, and a 401(k) Retirement Plan with an Employer match. Employees are also eligible to take advantage of company discounts and perks including Pet Insurance, Home & Auto Insurance, Mortgage discounts, and a variety of other savings on wellness, lifestyle, and financial essentials. As part of PMC's dedication to consistently meeting employees' needs, we are currently launching a new Flexible Vacation Policy.

At PMC, we believe working in a highly collaborative, office-first environment fosters real-time communication, spontaneous idea sharing, and stronger interpersonal relationships that drive innovation and team cohesion. PMC prioritizes in-person collaboration and does not offer remote-only roles.

**About Variety:**

Variety is the #1 entertainment news brand. Now celebrating 120 years of award-winning breaking news reporting, insightful award-season coverage, must-read feature spotlights, and intelligent analysis of the industry's most prominent players, Variety remains the most trusted source for the business of global entertainment. Read by a highly engaged audience of industry insiders, entertainment fans, executive level professionals and decisionmakers, Variety's multi-platform content coverage expands across digital, mobile, social, print, podcasts, branded content, data, events and summits. Variety is a subsidiary of PME TopCo., a joint venture between Penske Media Corporation and Eldridge. For more information, please visit www.variety.com.

**About PMC:**

Penske Media Corporation (PMC) is a leading global media and information services company whose award-winning content attracts a passionate audience of over 300 million globally. Since 2004, PMC has been a pioneer in digital media reaching viewers on all screens across its ever-growing constellation of iconic brands, which includes Variety, Rolling Stone, The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard, Dick Clark Productions, WWD, SHE Media, Robb Report, Deadline, TVLine, Sportico, BGR, ARTnews, Fairchild Media, Vibe, IndieWire, Artforum, Gold Derby, and Luminate, the premier data and analytics company. PMC's journalists and content creators deliver daily the most comprehensive news and information in their industries and areas of coverage, unequaled in ambition, depth, and courage. In addition, PMC owns several vital cultural events such as SXSW, LA3C, and Latin Music Week. Headquartered in New York and Los Angeles with additional offices in 14 countries worldwide, PMC believes companies should not only be profitable but also forces for good. PMC is committed to fostering a working environment that is inclusive and responsible, where we value a company culture built on all backgrounds, voices, and experiences. For more information on the company, please visit www.PMC.com

title: SVP, SMB Digital Sales
description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

**Job Description**
-------------------

The SVP, SMB Digital Sales is responsible for banking product sales to small and medium-sized business customers, interacting in US Bank’s digital channels. This leader must be sales and customer-focused, and will drive opportunities for revenue growth and optimization of sales activities. This leader will collaborate with product and marketing partners on launching new growth initiatives, and improving operational efficiency, productivity, and controls. This individual provides leadership to a large team of direct sales personnel, organized by product and acquisition funnel stage. This role reports directly to the SVP, Business Banking GTM and Business Development.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Shape Direct Sales Strategy: Define the vision, strategic direction, and operational plans needed to exceed customer expectations and sales goals. Coordinate between centralized sales support teams, marketing, and product groups on strategic initiatives. Maintain awareness of the competitive environment and recommend strategies to increase sales performance and revenue.
* Accelerate Revenue Growth: Responsible for driving annual sales revenue growth, including forecasting performance and tracking results. Monitor sales, revenue, and funnel performance across products sales and customer acquisition funnel
* Enhance Sales Effectiveness: Identifies opportunities for efficiency and growth, and drives the development of collateral material, sales training, operational procedures, and systems requirements to ensure sales personnel are set up for success.
* Build a High-Performing Sales Organization: Manage a team of 50+ sales personnel and leaders. Drive talent management and development. Make decisions around staffing, appraisals, promotions, salary, and terminations.
* Compliance: Ensures compliance with all U.S. Bancorp policies and procedures such as the Code of Ethics and all Anti-Money Laundering, Bank Secrecy Act, information security and suspicious activity reporting requirements, etc.

**Essential Qualifications:**

This is a senior level, highly seasoned and experienced position requiring strong leadership and management skills. The position requires a thorough knowledge of sales concepts and the bank’s products in order to respond to customer inquiries from small and medium-sized businesses, and drive sales revenue.

* 10 years of banking experience
* 8 or more years of sales management/leadership experience
* MBA preferred
* Well-developed leadership abilities and strategic management skills.
* Proven experience in sales management and business development
* Knowledge of banking products
* Experience in team leadership, mentorship, and performance management
* Well-developed verbal and written communication skills
* Strong analytical mindset, decision-making, and problem-solving skills
* Strong interpersonal and influence/partnership skills
* Good organizational and project management skills
* Proficiency in CRM tools and sales analytics platforms

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

**Benefits:**

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

* Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
* Basic term and optional term life insurance
* Short-term and long-term disability
* Pregnancy disability and parental leave
* 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan
* Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
* Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities
* Adoption assistance
* Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, and other factors protected under applicable law.

**E-Verify**

U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, U.S. Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401(k) contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $170,255.00 - $200,300.00

U.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment. U.S. Bank conducts background checks consistent with applicable local laws, including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act as well as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. U.S. Bank is subject to, and conducts background checks consistent with the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (FDIA). In addition, certain positions may also be subject to the requirements of FINRA, NMLS registration, Reg Z, Reg G, OFAC, the NFA, the FCPA, the Bank Secrecy Act, the SAFE Act, and/or federal guidelines applicable to an agreement, such as those related to ethics, safety, or operational procedures.

Applicants must be able to comply with U.S. Bank policies and procedures including the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct and related workplace conduct and safety policies.

**Posting may be closed earlier due to high volume of applicants.**
