title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

  
About BEC Technologies  
BEC Technologies is a leader in 4G/LTE and 5G industrial IoT and networking, delivering secure, reliable connectivity for system integrators, carriers, managed service providers (MSPs), and enterprise customers worldwide. We build advanced wireless WAN, edge computing, and AI-connected solutions that power mission-critical networks and applications. Our people drive this mission, and it is their ideas, collaboration, and commitment that fuel the innovation behind our products and help customers thrive in a digital-first world.  
  
Role Overview:  
The Vice President of Sales is a senior executive responsible for building, leading, and scaling BEC’s revenue organization. This leader will define the sales strategy, strengthen partner and channel ecosystems, accelerate market penetration across core verticals, and drive consistent, predictable growth. The role requires strong experience in telecommunications, wireless networking, and industrial IoT, combined with the ability to lead a high-performance team and collaborate across product, marketing, engineering, and operations.  
  
Key Responsibilities:  

* Foster a collaborative and results-oriented team culture, focused on continuous improvement and professional growth.
* Develop and implement strategies to optimize the performance of each sales region, ensuring consistent and predictable revenue growth.
* Establish organizational structures, staffing, processes, and methods to ensure successful achievement of sales targets and objectives.
* Ensure NetSuite is always up to date with accurate opportunities, notes, and next steps.
* Set sales targets for each region and then deliver on those goals.
* Build sales quotas and manage major commissions with sales operations and finance.
* Provide hands-on support to sales leaders, including participating in key customer engagements and negotiations as needed.
* Collaborate with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment of sales strategies with company goals.
* Drive the development and execution of sales strategies to achieve and exceed revenue targets provided by company leadership.
* Implement best practices in sales forecasting, pipeline management, and reporting to ensure accurate and predictable revenue outcomes.
* Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, adjusting strategies and tactics to address any gaps or opportunities.
* Ensure that all field sales teams are deeply engaged with customers, understanding their needs, and delivering value-added solutions.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Champion a customer-first approach across all field sales teams, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty.

  
Required Qualifications  

* 15+ years of experience in field sales or a similar role within the networking, telecommunications, or IoT industry.
* Minimum of 5 years in a leadership role, with proven experience managing and developing sales teams.
* Familiarity with the 4G/5G industrial IoT, networking, SD-WAN, and secure edge-compute solutions markets.
* Established senior executive relationships at AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, and major MVNOs
* Experience working in a global organization with multiple sales regions and diverse product lines.
* Demonstrated ability to lead high performing sales teams, driving predictable revenue growth and achieving sales targets.
* Strong industry references.
* Deep understanding of the sales process, including pipeline management, forecasting, and closing large, complex deals.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to travel as needed to support global field sales teams and customer engagements.

  
What We Offer  

* Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives.
* Professional growth and leadership development opportunities.
* A collaborative, innovative environment focused on customer success and continuous improvement.
* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Life insurance and 401(k) with company match
* Paid vacation and sick leave

  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Vice President of Commercial Lines Sales
description:
**Summary:**

The VP of Commercial Sales at WalkerHughes Insurance is responsible for direct management of commercial producers, driving pipeline discipline, enforcing sales cadence, and optimizing producer performance. This role will help develop and execute strategic sales plans in partnership with senior leadership. This role is designed for a high-caliber commercial sales leader who initially assumes full responsibility for producer execution, with opportunity for future expansion based on performance and organizational growth.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Lead, manage, and mentor a team of commercial insurance producers across varying levels of experience.
* Help develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve revenue and growth targets.
* Monitor individual producer performance metrics, providing coaching and performance feedback.
* Train and onboard new sales team members with a primary focus on sales techniques, methodology, and systems.
* Partner with the central risk placement team align sales goals with carrier strategies and targeted production opportunities.
* Establish and enforce consistent pipeline standards including opportunity qualification, stage definitions, and activity expectations.
* Enforce consistent pipeline reporting and opportunity progression across all commercial producers.
* Establish and enforce consistent weekly and monthly producer sales cadence.
* Participate directly in producer recruiting, interviewing, and selection.
* Own producer onboarding framework including 30-60-90-day expectations and development benchmarks.
* Establish producer performance scorecards and manage underperformance through documented improvement plans.
* Make recommendations regarding producer retention, termination, and compensation adjustments.
* Drive producer development, niche specialization, and long-term growth progression.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, Insurance, or related field required.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in commercial lines insurance sales, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Prior experience leading a sales division, business unit, or multi-producer team with full performance accountability strongly preferred.

title: Copy of Vice President of Sales
company_addresses:
3627 E. Indian School Rd. suite 205
Phoenix, AZ   85018
description:
The Vice President of Sales will be a strategic and hands-on leader responsible for driving revenue growth, guiding sales strategy, and developing a high-performance team. Leading a team of Sales Managers and a Sales Enablement Manager, this role will forecast trends, align sales processes with company goals, and build a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement. While setting the strategic direction, the VP will also roll up their sleeves when needed—co-pitching with reps, engaging directly with clients, and solving challenges in real time. This is a unique opportunity for a sales leader who thrives in both a strategy planning meeting and on the sales floor, and is ready to help BizIQ scale to impact 150,000 businesses.

**ABOUT THE COMPANY**

At BizIQ, our mission is to accelerate business growth through innovative and affordable digital marketing solutions. We are a trusted Google Featured Partner, with a success record of helping over 36,000 small businesses enhance their online presence. Nationally recognized for our award-winning culture and listed on the Inc 5000 as one of the fastest-growing companies, we also hold an A+ BBB rating for ethical business conduct. With a vision to impact 150,000 businesses, our organization is built on a foundation of commitment to our core values: Growth Mindset, Results Oriented, Innovative, Inspirational, Accountable and Transparency.

**OBJECTIVES**

* Lead, mentor, and motivate four Sales Managers, a Sales Enablement Manager, and their teams to maximize performance, develop leadership capability, and build a **high-energy, cohesive, and results-driven sales culture.**
* Build accurate sales forecasts, manage budgets, and provide actionable reporting that enables strategic decision-making and ensures consistent alignment with company revenue and profitability goals.
* Continuously analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitor strategies to design and execute strategic sales plans that uncover new opportunities, protect existing market share, and accelerate growth.
* Champion new client acquisition and upselling strategies, while actively co-pitching with reps when needed to ensure success. Consistently drive the team to exceed sales targets and expand BizIQ’s footprint with small and medium-sized businesses nationwide.
* Identify, validate, and execute opportunities for new products, solutions, and go-to-market channels, diversifying revenue streams and positioning BizIQ as a leader in digital marketing innovation.
* Partner with Marketing, Product, Operations, and Client Success to ensure seamless customer experiences, maximize retention, and align sales initiatives with company-wide strategic growth priorities.

**COMPETENCIES**

* **Inspirational Leadership -** Demonstrates the ability to inspire, empower, and guide the sales team by setting clear goals, holding others accountable, recognizing achievements, and modeling company values.
* **Sales Mastery & Process Excellence -** Drives sales success by applying advanced selling techniques, refining methodologies, and aligning sales processes with organizational objectives.
* **Strategic Market Insight -** Anticipates market trends and competitive shifts, leveraging data and insights to create strategies that identify growth opportunities and unlock new revenue streams.
* **Talent Development & Team Building -** Attracts, develops, and retains top-performing sales talent through training, coaching, performance management, and career development.
* **Data-Driven Performance Management -** Uses data and analytics to set sales goals, track KPIs, optimize performance, and communicate insights that align results with company strategy.
* **Customer-Centric Approach -** Ensures exceptional customer experiences that enhance satisfaction, retention, loyalty, and long-term client value
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration -** Builds effective partnerships across marketing, product, and operations to align initiatives and deliver seamless outcomes for clients.
* **Brand & Values Advocacy -** Serves as a brand ambassador by enhancing BizIQ’s reputation, ensuring sales practices reflect the company’s mission, values, and ethical standards.
* **Change Leadership & Innovation -** Adopts emerging tools, embraces organizational change, and fosters a culture of creativity, resilience, and agility in evolving markets.
* **Financial & Forecasting Acumen -** Develops accurate forecasts, manages budgets effectively, and aligns sales strategies with financial goals to maximize revenue and profitability.

**EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION**

* 15+ years experience in sales and revenue generation, in a leadership role with a focus on driving revenue growth and achieving business objectives.
* 10+ years experience of leading and managing a team of sales leaders, including strategic development of revenue performance, identifying areas for improvement, and making data-driven decisions.
* 5+ years of understanding of the digital marketing landscape, familiarity with digital analytics, online advertising, search engine optimization and social media marketing.
* A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as business, marketing, or finance is a preferred

**EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION**

* Health Benefits: United Health Medical plans (with Company HSA Contribution), MetLife Dental plans, Vision plan, Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and more
* Paid Time Off: 15 days of PTO accrued annually, 6 paid holidays, plus 4 floating holidays
* Retirement Savings: 401K
* Parental leave: Inclusive and supportive parental leave policy
* Peer-to-peer Recognition: We call it BizBucks - a rewards program where you can receive weekly prizes Including Amazon gift cards or other prices.
* Award Winning Culture: A fun, energetic workplace, with a supportive atmosphere, no traveling required

**COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY**

As an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, BizIQ values a staff reflective of our community. We hire talent at all levels, regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability. We actively foster inclusion within our company and in all interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.

title: Vice President Revenue Cycle Management
description:
**Recognized as a “Best Place to Work Modern Healthcare” – Join a team where people come first.** At Vital Care, we are committed to creating an inclusive, growth-focused environment where every voice matters.

Vital Care is the premier pharmacy franchise business with franchises serving a wide range of patients, including those with chronic and acute conditions. Since 1986, our passion has been improving the lives of patients and healthcare professionals through locally-owned franchise locations across the United States. We have over 100 franchised Infusion pharmacies and clinics in 35 states, focusing on the underserved and secondary markets. We know infusion services, and we guide owners along the path of launch, growth, and successful business operations.

What we offer:

* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, plus flexible spending, and health savings accounts.
* Paid time off, personal days, and company-paid holidays.
* Paid Paternal Leave.
* Volunteerism Days off.
* Income protection programs include company-sponsored basic life insurance and long-term disability insurance, as well as employee-paid voluntary life, accident, critical illness, and short-term disability insurance.
* 401(k) matching and tuition reimbursement.
* Employee assistance programs include mental health, financial and legal.
* Rewards programs offered by our medical carrier.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* Employee Referral Program.

***Job Summary:***

Vital Care’s Vice President of Revenue Cycle Management will be responsible for developing and managing a robust department to continue evolving and implementing strategies to support Vital Care and its franchisees. Specifically, the role will have responsibility for a combination of departments varying from intake, authorizations, billing, collections, and supporting functions within the Revenue Cycle Team. They will ensure the deployment of appropriate goals, measures, and management to create repeatable and reliable outcomes for the Vital Care franchise network. This role will support the rapid expansion of the Vital Care franchise network across the United States. A key priority will be implementing technology, productivity, and lean operating models to standardize RCM performance within the specific area of Revenue Cycle responsibility.

The Vice President of Revenue Cycle Management will serve as a member of Vital Care’s broader leadership team, playing an active and strategic role within the RCM Team while also supporting the franchises in Revenue Cycle Management. As Vital Care expands, the Vice President of Revenue Cycle Management will grow the revenue cycle department to support the business for a nationwide network of Vital Care sites.

The Vice President of Revenue Cycle Management will develop systems and capabilities to lead a world-class team and consistently deliver repeatable and reliable revenue cycle outcomes. A priority will be placed on adopting automated systems and tools to enhance processes and more effectively track and report progress, thereby creating value aligned with the company’s plans. Working collaboratively with leadership, this person will be accountable for consistently achieving goals to meet the business's current and future needs.

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Develop, Plan, and implement reimbursement strategies and initiatives to improve operations and results.
* Develop and define department procedures, and objectives, ensuring alignment with the company goals.
* Ensure key performance indicators are closely monitored and that the appropriate decisions and actions are taken promptly to remedy operational issues.
* Drives process improvement initiatives, strategic plan implementation, and change management actions to maximize revenue and maintain Compliance standards.
* Define, Measure, and Manage performance by functional area within their responsibility.
* Drives the performance of the employees by establishing expectations and goals and providing formal and informal feedback throughout the year.
* Develop and implement policies and procedures for areas within their responsibility.
* Provide leadership, guidance, and coaching to all direct reports to maintain an engaged and productive workforce, partnering with Human Resources on employee relations issues.
* Strategic leader with broad knowledge of the business/industry, emphasizing providing strategic solutions to the RCM department.
* Responsible for developing strategic plans to ensure the successful implementation of action plans and objectives, where analysis of the situation and data requires in-depth knowledge of the company, the franchise, payor, product, etc.
* Research emerging trends, evaluate opportunities, and provide recommendations supporting Vital Care's key initiatives.
* Uses, creates, and synthesizes data to develop and drive RCM operational efficiency and departmental strategies.
* Visits Vital Care locations when traveling in territories to gather assistance from franchise owners for RCM efforts.
* Serves as the Revenue Cycle policy subject matter expert.
* Coordinates efforts to evaluate, prioritize, and resolve franchisee requests for assistance regarding revenue cycle functions.
* Provides support and representation across all team segments, as needed.
* Works closely with the Field Operations team to support new, recurring initiatives across the franchise network.
* Represent the company at national, regional, and local conferences.
* Provide technical guidance specifically to internal and external RCM systems deployed by Vital Care.

Required Skills/Abilities:

* Prior experience managing a Specialty Pharmacy, Home Infusion, or Specialty Infusion Revenue Cycle department.
* Proficient in using various software, including Microsoft Office Suite, CPR+ or Caretend, Home Care Net, and other related pharmacy operating systems.
* Excellent organizational skills required.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
* Ability to prioritize projects and work independently.
* Excellent customer service skills are required.

Education and Experience:

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or finance.
* MBA preferred.

Physical Requirements:

* Sitting: Prolonged periods of sitting are typical, often for the majority of the workday.
* Keyboarding: Frequent use of a keyboard for typing and data entry.
* Reaching: Occasionally reaching for items such as files, documents, or office supplies.
* Fine Motor Skills: Precise movements of the fingers and hands for tasks like typing, using a mouse, and handling paperwork.
* Visual Acuity: Good vision for reading documents, computer screens, and other detailed work.

Be part of an organization that invests in you! We are reviewing applications for this role and will contact qualified candidates for interviews.  
  
Vital Care Infusion Services is an equal-opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of color, race, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, gender identity, sexual orientation, veterans’ status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.  
  
Vital Care Infusion Services participates in E-Verify.

This position is full-time.

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**About Monaire**
-----------------

Monaire is transforming how commercial buildings manage HVAC systems through AI-powered automation and insights. We combine sensors, smart thermostats, and machine learning to deliver massive energy savings, operational transparency, and sustainability impact.  
  
We’re not just another building-tech tool. Monaire has become the go-to platform customers rave about because it works immediately, deploys cleanly, and produces results that move the needle. The market is massive, broken, and wide open for a dominant player. We’re scaling fast and need a VP of Sales who can convert this demand into a disciplined, high-velocity revenue engine — someone who can build the team, enforce the process, and win the category.

**Role Overview**

We’re looking for a VP of Sales who can **build and scale a world-class sales team from the ground up**, impose operational rigor, and consistently outperform aggressive targets. This isn’t a “maintain the machine” role — it’s a **build, optimize, and win** mandate.

You will own revenue, hiring, coaching, processes, forecasting accuracy, and pipeline creation. You must be able to operate strategically *and* get your hands dirty in deals when needed.

If you can’t grow a team, fix weak pipelines, or call bullshit on bad forecasts, this role will expose that fast.

**Key Responsibilities**
========================

### **Team Building & Leadership**

* Build, scale, and lead a high-performing AE team with a culture of accountability, coaching, and constant improvement.
* Recruit A-players and remove low performers quickly — no tolerance for mediocrity in a hyper-growth environment.
* Implement repeatable hiring standards, onboarding, playbooks, and coaching systems.

### **Revenue Ownership**

* Own and deliver quarterly and annual revenue targets with precision.
* Drive disciplined pipeline development, deal velocity, and conversion rates.
* Set clear expectations and performance metrics; enforce them ruthlessly.

### **Sales Strategy & Execution**

* Architect a scalable sales model that aligns with Monaire’s product, market motion, and customer profile.
* Build territory design, quota models, comp plans, and forecasting frameworks that actually work.
* Collaborate tightly with founders, product, and marketing to refine positioning and accelerate adoption.

### **Process, Systems & Forecasting**

* Install CRM hygiene, reporting clarity, and operational guardrails that prevent surprises.
* Build the processes AEs *actually follow*, not theoretical decks.
* Maintain accurate forecasts and dashboards; no sandbagging, no wishful thinking.

### **Customer & Market Intelligence**

* Build relationships with key decision-makers (Facility Managers, Sustainability Directors, C-suite), handle escalations, and ensure successful onboarding.
* Bring structured feedback loops from the field into product and GTM teams.
* Understand customer ROI deeply and ensure AEs articulate it with conviction.
* Develop deep knowledge of HVAC management industry trends and competitor offerings.
* Identify new markets, verticals, and expansion paths — we’re barely scratching the surface of the opportunity.

### **Requirements**

### **Must-Have**

* Proven success scaling an AE team from early-stage to high-growth, ideally in B2B tech or HVAC/building tech adjacent markets.
* Demonstrable track record of hitting aggressive revenue targets for several consecutive years.
* The ability to design and run a sales engine, not just “manage reps.”
* Strong operational discipline — forecasting accuracy, pipeline scrutiny, data-driven decisions.
* Strong recruiter and coach; knows how to build a top-5% team.
* Comfortable with fast decisions, minimal bureaucracy, and founder-level expectations.

### **Nice-to-Have**

* Experience in IoT, building automation, HVAC, energy management, or proptech.
* Background selling hardware-plus-software solutions.
* Previously owned revenue in a Series A–C environment.

**What Success Looks Like in 12 Months**
========================================

* AE team scaled with consistent quota attainment across the board.
* Predictable pipeline generation with tight qualification discipline.
* Forecast accuracy within a reasonable tolerance — no fire drills.
* Revenue growth that materially outpaces market norms.
* A sales culture defined by accountability, transparency, and winning.

### **Benefits**

* Mission-driven: Reduce carbon emissions and operational costs for the built environment
* Early ownership: You’ll define how Monaire grows
* Fast feedback loop: Your campaigns will have visible, immediate impact on revenue
* Work with a sharp, motivated team of engineers, designers, and operators building category-defining tech
* Competitive base salary and meaningful equity
* Unlimited PTO

title: Practice VP, AWS Sales
description:
**Description**

At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re proud to share our story and Make Amazing Happen at CDW.

**About the Role**

The Practice VP, AWS Sales, is a key member of Mission’s leadership team. As part of CDW, Mission continues its focus as an AWS Premier Tier Services Partner, enabling organizations to transform through migration, modernization, managed services, DevOps, security, and AI-driven solutions.

You will own the end-to-end revenue lifecycle spanning sales, channel alliances, go-to-market strategy, and integration with customer success. This role ensures all revenue functions are aligned to maximize growth, strengthen AWS and channel partnerships, and deliver long-term value to customers. You will drive alignment, focus and collaboration across AWS’ and CDW’s sales segments and key leaders.

This role is 100% remote.

**Responsibilities**

* Define and execute Mission’s Sales strategy.
* Drive predictable revenue growth through pipeline development, bookings, renewals, and expansion opportunities.
* Deepen executive-level relationships with AWS, ensuring strong field alignment, joint programs, and co-sell momentum.
* Strengthen partnership with CDW go-to-market teams, positioning Mission’s AWS practice across CDW sales geographies and segments.
* Lead and develop a distributed team of sales and revenue leaders, instilling a culture of accountability, performance, and customer-first focus.
* Oversee strategic negotiations with customers and partners, ensuring favorable outcomes and long-term partnerships.
* Provide the executive team with clear visibility into performance, risks, and growth opportunities.

**Requirements**

* Proven track record in senior revenue leadership roles in cloud consulting, technology services, or AWS ecosystem organizations.
* Deep knowledge of the AWS ecosystem, including co-sell motions, funding programs, and partner strategy.
* Demonstrated success aligning sales, alliances, and customer success functions to deliver sustainable revenue growth.
* Strong executive presence with the ability to influence internally at CDW and externally with customers and AWS.
* Experience scaling revenue organizations during phases of rapid growth and integration.
* Track record of selling and expanding complex, multi-service consulting engagements (migration, modernization, managed services, AI/ML).
* Exceptional communication, strategic planning, and organizational skills.
* Ability to travel up to 50%.

**We make technology work so people can do great things.**

CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW helps its customers to navigate an increasingly complex IT market and maximize return on their technology investments. Together, we unite. Together, we win. Together, we thrive.

CDW is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by state and local law.

CDW is committed to fostering an equitable, transparent, and respectful hiring process for all applicants. During our application process, CDW’s goal is to get to know you as an applicant and understand your experience, strengths, skills, and qualifications. While AI can help you present yourself more clearly and effectively, the essence of your application should be authentically yours. To learn more, please review CDW's AI Applicant Notice.

  

**Job ID:** R25\_00003785

**Team:** Corporate

**Focus Area:** Executive

**Location:** Virtual, FL, United States

**Remote Type:** Remote

**Date Posted:** Dec 11, 2025

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**Job Title:** Vice President of Sales  
**Company:** Valenzano Family Winery  
**Location:** Shamong, NJ (On-site)  
**Job Type:** Full-time  
**Compensation:** From $100,000 per year + bonus incentives

**About Valenzano Family Winery**  
Valenzano Family Winery is one of New Jersey’s largest wine producers, operating a growing self-distribution network with statewide wholesale accounts across liquor stores, restaurants, bars, and regional retailers. As we continue to scale our wholesale footprint, we are seeking a senior, hands-on sales leader to drive revenue growth while ensuring strong execution across our distribution operation.

**Position Summary**  
The Vice President of Sales will own the strategy and execution of Valenzano’s wholesale sales channel. This role is responsible for leading and developing the sales team, growing key accounts, expanding placements, increasing sales velocity, and ensuring the operational execution required to support best-in-class customer service. This is a field-driven leadership role requiring regular in-market presence with key customers, combined with ownership of the sales systems, processes, and execution that support revenue growth.

**Key Responsibilities**

The Vice President of Sales will lead and manage the wholesale sales team, including hiring, training, coaching, performance management, and accountability. The role will drive revenue growth through expanded placements, improved velocity, and penetration of new and existing accounts. The VP of Sales will spend approximately three days per week in the field calling on key accounts, strengthening relationships with liquor stores, bars and restaurants, chain buyers, and regional retailers. Responsibilities include running weekly sales meetings, establishing clear KPIs, enforcing accountability metrics, overseeing customer pricing strategy and monthly price lists, developing sales materials, and planning and executing tastings, samplings, and in-store activations.

In addition to sales leadership, this role will ensure strong sales execution by partnering closely with warehouse, delivery, and operations teams. The VP of Sales will provide oversight of delivery scheduling and routing to support customer satisfaction, collaborate on route optimization and service improvements, and ensure alignment between sales priorities, inventory availability, and delivery capabilities. This role will also provide leadership input into fleet planning and operational efficiency as it relates to servicing wholesale customers.

The Vice President of Sales will lead the implementation and ongoing improvement of sales and distribution systems, including tools for order processing, invoicing, customer management, routing, and reporting. The role will build and review dashboards to track sales performance, customer trends, account-level metrics, and execution quality, using data to identify opportunities and drive corrective action.

The role will ensure all sales activities and product launches comply with applicable ABC, TTB, and COLA regulations, coordinating required filings and maintaining accurate compliance documentation related to wholesale sales.

**Qualifications**

The ideal candidate will have at least five years of experience in wine, spirits, or beverage distribution sales, with a proven track record of leading and managing wholesale sales teams. Strong field sales leadership and key account management experience is required, along with a clear understanding of how logistics, delivery, and operations impact sales execution. Candidates must be comfortable implementing sales systems, CRM or DMS tools, and using data to drive decisions. Strong leadership, communication, organizational skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment are essential.

Preferred qualifications include experience within a winery, craft beverage producer, or small-to-mid-sized distributor, as well as familiarity with ERP or DMS platforms such as VIP, Encompass, Ekos, or similar systems.

**Compensation & Benefits**

This is a full-time, on-site role offering a base salary starting at $100,000 per year, commensurate with experience, plus a performance-based bonus structure tied to sales growth and execution. Benefits include health coverage, mileage reimbursement or vehicle allowance, and the opportunity for long-term growth within the company.

**Schedule & Work Location**

Full-time, in-person role based in Shamong, NJ. Expect approximately one to two days per week at the winery and three days per week in the field visiting accounts.

**How to Apply**

Submit your resume through Indeed. Candidates with relevant beverage distribution and sales leadership experience will be contacted for an interview.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Shamong, NJ 08088

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
Heartland is seeking a **Vice President of Sales** to lead, coach, and scale our sales organization through its next phase of growth. This is an executive leadership role for someone who has direct experience leading technology sales in the markets we serve and who believes the best sales leaders are visible, engaged, and in front of customers alongside their teams. This role is accountable for revenue growth, pipeline health, profitability, and sales execution while strengthening Heartland's culture and reputation as a trusted partner.

***About Heartland***

Heartland is a trusted technology and services partner serving supply chain, logistics, manufacturing, and frontline workforce environments. We specialize in supply chain technology solutions, services and enterprise technology, and managed services. We work closely with leading partners such as Honeywell, Zebra, SOTI, Panasonic, and others related to the supply chain industry. Our success is built on long-term customer relationships, strong partnerships, and a collaborative, team-first culture. This position reports to the PresidentGeneral Manager. Location is flexible, with a strong preference given to candidates local to our corporate office to support in-person collaboration, coaching, and leadership presence. Travel is required, approximately 35%.

***What You'll Do***

1. Lead With Industry Credibility

* Bring hands-on leadership experience in technology sales within supply chain, logistics, distribution, manufacturing, mobility, or AIDC environments.
* Serve as a visible, credible leader with customers, partners, and internal teams.
* Participate directly in executive-level customer meetings and strategic sales pursuits.

2. Build, CoachMentor the Sales Organization

* Recruit, develop, and retain high-performing sales leaders and sellers.
* Act as a coach and mentor, fostering a team culture where sellers feel supported-always knowing you've "got their back"-while helping them grow and succeed.
* Lead from the front through field engagement, deal coaching, and hands-on support.
* Foster a culture of teamwork, accountability, trust, and continuous improvement.

3. Drive GrowthPerformance

* Own sales strategy, execution, forecasting, and results.
* Deliver consistent, profitable revenue growth.
* Expand existing customer relationships while driving new customer acquisition.
* Identify and pursue new growth markets aligned with Heartland's capabilities.

4. Strengthen CustomerPartner Relationships

* Leverage experience working with technology partners and ecosystem partners
* Ensure a consultative, solutions-driven approach across all sales engagements.
* Deepen Heartland's role as a long-term, trusted technology and services partner.

5. Collaborate Across Heartland

* Partner closely with executive leadership, operations, services, and solution teams.
* Align sales strategy with delivery capabilities and customer success outcomes.
* Help evolve Heartland's go-to-market strategy as the business scales.

6. Advance Market Strategy and Innovation

* Anticipate market shifts and emerging opportunities ahead of competitors.
* Conduct ongoing competitive analysis to understand position, strengths, and gaps in the market.
* Maintain strong awareness of product innovation and competitive dynamics.
* Use customer insights to shape new offerings, strategies, and growth initiatives.

***What We're Looking For***

* 10+ years of technology sales leadership experience preferred, with direct experience selling technology, software and services to supply chain operations or frontline technology environments.
* Proven ability to coach and operationalize an Ideal Client Profile (ICP) mindset, enabling teams to prospect by persona, sell to outcomes, and articulate value beyond products or price.
* Proven success building, coaching, and scaling sales organizations.
* A hands-on leader who enjoys being in front of customers and supporting sellers.
* Experience selling complex, solutions-based and services-led offerings (hardware, software, services, recurring revenue).
* Strong forecasting, pipeline management, and financial discipline.
* Leadership style aligned with Heartland's culture: collaborative, accountable, and people-first.

***Why Heartland***

* Deep, long-standing customer and partner relationships
* Strong culture built on trust, teamwork, and accountability
* Meaningful growth opportunity in a market you already understand
* Executive-level influence with the ability to shape strategy and culture

***Our Culture***

Heartland's success is built on a foundation of core values: passionate, dedicated, agile, collaborative team players, and strategic creativity. We are also guided by strong values and a commitment to delivering exceptional customer service. Our commitment is strong to our customers and technology partners to earn their trust and be viewed as their best partner.

At Heartland, we invest in our people and our culture. Our professional development programs have included improvbased learning with Second City Works, building communication, collaboration, and leadership skills in an interactive, handson way. We partner with Chicago Innovation to rub elbows with the city's top innovators, executives, and emerging talent, bringing fresh ideas back to our business. Our work has earned us recognition as Honeywell's Partner of the Year for two consecutive years, reflecting our technical expertise, collaborative approach, and commitment to exceptional service.

We seek a sales leader who embodies these values and this mindset in every customer interaction, team decision, and growth opportunity.

Take the lead at Heartland and guide our sales organization into its next phase of growth.

Learn more here: **https://heartland-usa.com/heartland-employees-rock/**

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**ABOUT 10X HEALTH SYSTEM**  
10X Health System is a pioneering company at the forefront of the health and wellness industry, dedicated to revolutionizing the way individuals approach their personal health and well-being. With a philosophy rooted in the principle that optimal health is the foundation for a life lived to the fullest, 10X Health provides cutting-edge solutions and personalized health plans designed to empower individuals to achieve and maintain peak physical and mental performance.

The company's comprehensive approach to health combines the latest advances in medical science, nutrition, fitness, and technology to offer a suite of services that include state-of-the-art diagnostic testing, individualized treatment protocols, and ongoing support from a team of world-class health professionals. 10X Health's commitment to innovation and results has established it as a leader in the health optimization space, catering to those who strive to push the boundaries of what is possible in their health journey.  
  
**POSITION SUMMARY**  
The Vice President of Sales is a key executive leader responsible for driving revenue growth, elevating the luxury client experience, and shaping the strategy for all Sales operations across 10X Health. This role leads the full wellness sales organization, sets the vision for team performance, strengthens cross functional alignment with Marketing and Operations, and ensures that every client interaction reflects the premium standard of the 10X brand.  
  
This individual will own sales strategy, organizational development, and the performance culture that empowers teams to consistently exceed targets. This role requires a leader who can build, inspire, and scale high-performing teams while maintaining an unwavering commitment to remarkable client care.  
  
**OBJECTIVES**

* Own the revenue strategy and guide the full Wellness organization to consistently exceed sales targets across Blood Tests, HRT and Peptide therapies, SuperHuman Protocols, Genetic Testing, and additional 10X Health services
* Deeply understand our luxury client base and ensure that every sales touchpoint aligns with the expectations of high-profile clients and high value buyers
* Lead ongoing call reviews and coaching sessions that raise the standard of communication, objection handling, and consultative selling across the team
* Partner with Marketing to improve the full client journey and increase conversion from lead to sale
* Oversee CRM usage across Salesforce and all relevant systems, ensuring data accuracy, reporting clarity, and clear visibility into the financial health of the Sales division
* Build and refine processes that streamline the sales cycle and enhance speed to close
* Track, report, and analyze key sales metrics to identify growth opportunities and operational improvements
* Maintain oversight of client escalations and ensure timely resolutions that protect the 10X Health client experience
* Document winning playbooks and scale success through structured training programs and repeatable processes
* Lead all leadership development within the Wellness organization including recurring development conversations, biweekly one on ones, performance coaching, and incentive planning
* Oversee the hiring, onboarding, and training of new Wellness team members to support rapid growth and future succession planning

**COMPETENCIES**

* Proven track record as a top performer in sales with a history of leading high growth revenue organizations
* Ability to deliver in elite client experience tailored to high profile and luxury buyers
* Deep expertise in the 10X Health product suite and the ability to guide clients through complex wellness solutions
* Strong knowledge of wellness, longevity, and the benefits of the 10X Health ecosystem
* Ability to step in and close high value deals and support team members through complex objections or challenging scenarios
* Advanced proficiency in Salesforce with the ability to train, optimize, and drive accountability across the team
* Strong decision-making skills with clear reasoning and sound judgment
* Demonstrates resilience, persistence, and an ownership mindset in achieving revenue outcomes

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

* 5 - 7+ years of sales leadership experience, ideally in a high growth or premium service environment
* Experience leading multi-level sales teams and managing revenue at scale
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales and Marketing, Business Administration, Business Management, or related field

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Ability to remain in a stationary position (e.g., sitting or standing) for extended periods
* Ability to operate a computer and other office equipment (e.g., keyboard, mouse, telephone, copier)
* Ability to communicate effectively in person and via digital channels (e.g., email, video conferencing, phone)
* Ability to occasionally move about inside the office or work environment
* Must be able to observe details on a computer screen and read written documents

**COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY**  
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, 10X Health System recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners. If you require any accommodations during the application process or have any questions, please contact careers@10xhealthsystem.com.  
  
**NO SOLICITATION POLICY**  
10X Health does not accept unsolicited resumes, calls, or communications from staffing agencies or third-party recruiters. Any such submissions will be considered the sole property of 10X Health and will not obligate the company to pay any fees. Please refrain from contacting us regarding this posting.

title: VP Sales, North America
description:
Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

  

At Agfa HealthCare, we support healthcare professionals across the globe to transform the delivery of care. Our focus is 100% on providing best-of-suite Imaging IT software solutions that enable secure, effective and sustainable imaging data management.

  

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.

This important leadership position reporting to the Senior Vice President of Sales, North America, is responsible for leading a dynamic hunting New Business team and growing new market share for Agfa HealthCare’s full portfolio of healthcare products in the United States.

  

**What You'll Do (Duties & Responsibilities):**

  

* Developing and maintaining a Business Plan with an associated strategy and tactical plan to achieve annual and quarterly sales goals in the US market
* Direct management of field sales staff, budget, forecasting, prospecting, and account strategy
* Achieve attainment of sales quota and business objectives for the growth of new name account sales
* Build and maintain a sales pipeline that reflects appropriate sales stage metrics and prospect migration in alignment with target market segments and annual sales plan
* Drive adherence to company-defined sales process and cadence with operating mechanisms
* Collaborate with colleagues across functional areas to create and present requests for information, requests for proposals, budgetary quotes, and negotiate contracts
* Build meaningful relationships with existing clients to ensure satisfaction and to assist in reference-based promotion of the company’s product and service
* Represent the company at trade association meetings to promote the company, product, and generate sales leads
* Demonstrate and continuously improve healthcare industry knowledge through participation in applicable healthcare industry associations, company-provided training, and industry education
* Provide relevant feedback to assist the company’s product leadership with investments in the research and development roadmap to improve competitive position and market share
* Maintain corporate-level relationships with established regional and national IDNs

  

**What You'll Bring (Experience & Specific Skills):**

  

* The ideal candidate will have a strong background in healthcare and technology sales, preferably in enterprise IT and/or digital diagnostic systems along with an understanding of the market and competitive landscape.
* The candidate must have a proven track record in sales as a hunter profile and sales leadership in new business development.
* A proven track record with 10+ years of successful enterprise healthcare information technology sales experience focused on capturing new business in the Healthcare IT Marketplace

  

**Specific Skills:**

  

* Demonstrated ability to lead a sales strategy internally and externally through complex organizations to achieve sales results
* Demonstrated ability to coach, mentor and lead a new business sales team effectively
* Ability to engage with and deliver the company’s value proposition to C-suite executives of healthcare systems
* Experience using a contemporary CRM system
* Miller Heiman Strategic and/or Solution Selling certification
* Superior business acumen and proven business development experience
* Strong negotiation skills, exceptional business demeanor and highly polished presentation skills to manage relationships from the executive to the working level
* Excellent networking skills and able to develop and create large and profitable business opportunities
* Ability to set strategy and execute tactics to deliver tangible results
* Commitment to teamwork and ability to foster productive working relationships with internal and external groups

  

**Required:**

  

* Sold PACS/Enterprise Imaging before in the US.
* Managed sales teams before.
* Has CIO & IT relationships in the East.
* Has Radiology leadership relationships in the East.
* A hunter. Someone who knows how to attract new customers and as important guide and mentor the team.
* A very proactive, collaborative, team-focused leader
* Someone with a proven record of building processes and establishing the right forecast rigor.

We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.  
If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment application process, please contact agfahealthcarehrna@agfa.com.

  

At Agfa HealthCare, we are passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes diversity of Age, Gender, Gender Identity or expression, Race, Sexual Orientation, Physical Ability, Ethnicity, or any other aspect that makes someone unique. The differences among us are our strengths. We are committed to promoting a diverse, equal and inclusive workplace that fully represents the different cultures, viewpoints and backgrounds of our global organization and the world we live in.

Learn more about Agfa HealthCare and follow us on Instagram.

title: VP of Business Sales
description:
Love Your Mondays again!

**Join the Future of Connectivity with Metronet!**

Are you ready to launch your career with one of the nation’s fastest-growing fiber-optic powerhouses? Welcome to Metronet, where we don’t just build networks; we build communities.

  

**VP of SMB Sales**

As the **VP of SMB Sales**, you will have full top-line responsibility for Metronet’s SMB direct sales business. This includes responsibility for increasing market share in existing fiber markets through new customer acquisitions and upsell as well as developing go-to-market strategies to exceed penetration rates in greenfield fiber markets. Success in this position will rely on the ability to drive revenue growth, implement, and standardize processes across the organization, attract and retain talent at all levels all while improving the overall customer experience. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated both strategic and tactical capability in Small and Medium business.

  

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

**Drive sales and growth to meet and exceed revenue and margin objectives**

* Manage the budget and P&L for the sales organization
* Partner with the construction and development teams in entering new markets including capital expenditure for dedicated new construction
* Oversee all sales activities in our Commercial segment
* Formulate and execute customer acquisition strategies, developing processes, organizational structure, and metrics necessary to hit and exceed sales objectives
* Develop an integrated channel strategy (SMB, inside sales) to maximize revenue and profitability
* Collaborate with business unit leaders in driving improved customer experience, process improvement, and cost discipline

**Build a modern, optimized sales organization**

* Modernize structure, talent and working processes with a view to transforming current sales practices to use a more strategic and insight-driven sales methodology with appropriate incentive plans in place to drive desired behavior
* Top-Grade existing team to ensure A-players are retained and others are improved or replaced
* Build a culture of professionalism, accountability in sales and drive continuous improvement of sales activity. Be a culture carrier.
* Implement an innovative route to market that includes sales organization design, channels partners, and sales operations to maximize effective and efficient market coverage
* Identify and build plans around financial improvement initiatives with strategic customers
* Create an efficient, effective customer engagement model to promote expanded coverage while reducing duplicative roles
* Identify, develop, and promote future sales leaders of the organization
* Execute price optimization initiatives to improve profitability

**Build on the existing marketing strategy and execution**

* Meet or exceed customer acquisition targets, upsell and penetration rates by developing lead generation initiatives and competitive offers
* Enhance and evolve digital marketing strategy including online search, display, and social media campaigns
* Develop new customer acquisition programs to support the launch of fiber services in new markets
* Develop programs in support of the customer experience to reduce customer churn and improve ROI across the customer lifecycle
* Develop program in new greenfield markets to drive brand awareness

**Align sales and marketing initiatives to accelerate the value creation plan**

* Establish go-to-market strategies and partner with leadership team to identify product service price points and deliver competitive analysis
* Provide leadership and collaborate across the organization in the pursuit of revenue targets with key business partners
* Coordinate with the network teams to assure capital deployment is aligned with sales efforts to maximize ROI
* Drive cost discipline within the business to achieve organizational goals
* Align with senior team members to identify the key financial levers to drive shareholder value on a consistent basis

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* 15+ years’ leadership experience in sales, preferably fiber internet
* 5+ years of experience with demonstrated success driving significant revenue growth in a multiplatform communications service provider of similar scale
* Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

**ADDITIONAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:**

* Experience managing multiple sales channels, including small-medium businesses, inside sales.
* Experience managing or working closely with marketing to optimize sales pipeline
* Team oriented, collaborative while inspiring followership on the team
* Available to travel for training or as needed.

  

Join us and find out what it means to love your career!

At **Metronet**, we are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology combined with exceptional customer care. Our 100% fiber-optic technology ensures that we provide our customers with some of the fastest internet speeds in the world. As industry leaders in fiber-to-the-premise TV, voice, and internet services, we’re not just focused on expanding our networks—we’re focused on enriching the lives of those we serve.

We value our associates because they are the cornerstone of our success. By joining the **Metronet** family, you’re stepping into a rewarding career in technology with a company dedicated to your growth and success. We’re in it to win it, and a key part of our strategy is to strengthen our business-to-business technology sales team with talented and hard-working individuals who aspire to be the next generation of technology leaders.

Recognized as one of the Best Places to Work, we offer a competitive total compensation package, including 80% of medical premiums paid by the company, company-paid disability and life insurance, and a 401(k)-company match with immediate vesting. Plus, enjoy discounted services within our coverage areas and thrive in a locally owned, friendly, and fun atmosphere.

Discover more with **Metronet** — a company where your success builds stronger communities, and your future is limitless.

  

**Metro****net** is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, race, gender, religion, age, national origin, color, disability, or veteran status. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran

title: TIHP Associate Vice President Revenue Program
company_addresses:
1908 N. Laurent St.
Suite #250
Victoria, TX 77901
description:
**Primary Responsibilities**

The Associate Vice President of Revenue Program is key senior level leader responsible for the strategic design, implementation and oversight of the organization’s risk adjustment program. This individual ensures accurate, compliant and optimized risk capture processes to support revenue integrity and population health strategies in Medicare Advantage. The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in CMS-HCC risk adjustment, clinical documentation improvement and has proven ability to lead high performing teams in a matrixed environment. Collaborate with other departments including finance, market and executive leadership, revenue cycle and other key stakeholders.

**Essential Functions**

* Develop and execute enterprise-wide risk adjustment strategy to align with regulatory requirements and financial objectives
* Oversee all aspects of risk adjustment including data analytics, coding accuracy, clinical documentation improvement strategy and vendor management
* Establish and implement productivity measures, perform quality controls, and monitor production Key Performance Indicators and Service Level Agreements
* Formulate strategic and operational objectives to achieve volume throughput and efficiencies
* Expert in SQL coding and data analytics
* Lead cross functional teams including coding, analytics, compliance, medical economics (Finance) and operations to ensure seamless integration of risk adjustment initiatives
* Monitor and ensure compliance with CMS, health plans, and state specific regulations and audit requirements
* Lead end-to-end timely and accurate submission of risk adjustment data to CMS including overseeing the reconciliation of CMS MAO-004 reports to validate submission accuracy
* Translate risk adjustment performance into actionable insights to support medical management and quality initiatives
* Drive innovation and efficiency in risk capture methodologies
* Partner with finance, actuarial, operations teams to forecast, track performance and manage risk score impacts for all contracted products
* Collaborate with Care Management leadership on provider education needs to ensure documentation and coding accuracy
* Evaluate and manage relationships with third party vendors providing risk adjustment services
* Serve as internal subject matter expert on all aspects of risk adjustment policy changes and risk scoring methodologies
* Executive level reporting identifying actual to expected performance, outlier trends and prevalence opportunities
* Recruit, train and supervise staff and daily work assignments
* Promote a culture of accountability, innovation and compliance

**Educational/Training Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree of Science in health information management, health informatics, biology, nursing, business administration or related to the health industry.

* Certified Risk Adjustment Coder with at least 5 years of experience in medical coding, medical billing, medical record reviewing, or provider representative experience.

**Knowledge**

* Expert level knowledge of CMS-HCC models V24 and V28, claims data lifecycle and submission systems
* Knowledge of coding, HCCs, risk adjustments concepts, medical record review project management, encounter data management, compliance audit concepts.
* Knowledge of change management.
* Knowledge of regulations related to data submission for Medicare Advantage, MMP, and Marketplace risk adjustment.
* Knowledge of 837P and 837I (5010) formats and file protocols.
* Knowledge of EDPS MAO file formats and protocols.
* Strong problem-solving ability and a customer-centric focus.
* Highly organized with a strong attention to detail.

* Must have ability to work as a team player with excellent communication skills.
* Must solve resource issue in a creative, positive manner.
* Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action.

**Experience Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in healthcare administration, accounting, finance, or related field; Master’s degree MBA, MHA, MPH preferred
* 10+ years of experience in risk adjustment, Medicare Advantage or related healthcare operations
* Strong understanding of healthcare economics, population health and value-based care frameworks

* Computer systems knowledge (Internet, Microsoft Office).
* Skill in enabling personnel Capacity of concentration and analysis.

**Physical Demands**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Availability/Travel Demands**

* Ability to work as a telecommuter

title: Regional Vice President, Commercial Sales
description:
Vyve Broadband is a nationally-recognized organization specializing in providing a variety of quality telecommunication services that meet the needs of consumers and businesses located in smaller communities. We are seeking a positive leader who has an inherent ability to develop business through motivation, team building and a desire to succeed.  
  
**Regional Vice President, Commercial Sales**  
  
**Job Responsibilities:**  
The Regional Vice President, Commercial Sales (“RVP”) manages the region’s profit center sales, financial performance, and community and government relations for its assigned region. It is responsible for increasing sales and applying positive leadership techniques to maintain a professional team to maximize sales opportunities, provide excellent responsive service to the customer and focus on achieving Vyve’s strategic goals. The RVP conveys a sense of urgency to achieve outcomes and exceed expectations and will persist and thrive despite obstacles and setbacks. It communicates effectively and builds relationships with all levels of the organization and external customers. This position reports to the Senior Vice President, Commercial Sales. This position involves travel throughout the sales territory (AR, LA, OK, and TX).  
  
**Desired Skills:**

* Proven success with inside, outside, and retention sales.
* Public relations and community outreach
* Leading, coaching and mentoring to develop top sales teams.
* Out of the box thinker.
* Excellent problem solving and negotiation skills.
* Takes the initiative to get things done and follow through on projects.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Results driven;
* High degree of sales skills;
* Excellent verbal and written communications;
* Self-motivated;
* Professional demeanor
* Energetic, upbeat, proactive individual who displays enthusiasm and passion for his/her work.

**Required Skills:**

* 7 to 10 years proven track record of successful leadership and management.
* Proven success with inside and outside sales and success in prospecting residential, small business and Enterprise/Gov-E
* College degree or equivalent work experience.

Pre-employment drug test, motor vehicle record and background check required.  
  
Vyve Broadband offers an exciting benefits package including subsidized employee and dependent medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), company paid life insurance, vacation, holiday and sick pay.  
  
*Vyve Broadband is an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, age, handicap, disability, marital status, veteran status, reserve or National Guard status, or any other status protected by applicable law.*
